column4: Ambiguuty between name and short ID
column5: Ambiguuty between name and short ID

column4:
Steps to reproduce:
1 - Create a container of any kind - say Ubuntu
2 - Create a container of another kind - say Redis and give it a name which is a prefix (say 5 chars long) of the former container ID (the one which was created at step 1) Let us mark this prefix and name with XXXXX
3 - docker inspect XXXXX

You will get the container from stage 2.
Looking at the code Get tries as follows:
1 - match exact name
2 - match full Id
3 - match partial ID
column5: You will get the container from stage 2.

column4: now since before the creation of the second container the command in 3 return the Ubuntu container and after it the Redis container return this seems to me like an ambiguity (and if you delete the redis you get the ubuntu again after the inspect command)
column5: now since before the creation of the second container the command in 3 return the Ubuntu container and after it the Redis container return this seems to me like an ambiguity (and if you delete the redis you get the ubuntu again after the inspect command)

column4:
Steps to Reproduce:
 1. docker run -it --name=host-1 ubuntu:14.04
 2. docker run -it --name=host-2 --link host-1 ubuntu:14.04

Actual Results:
 From the recipient container it is possible to `ping` the source container using its CONTAINER ID. However it is not possible to do the same from the source container to the recipient.

Actual Results:

column4:
Description of problem:
The docker network create command does not work with IPv6 subnets using iptables.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. `dnf --enablerepo=updates-testing install docker`
2. `docker network create --subnet=2001:470::/64 test`

Actual Results:
```
Error response from daemon: unable to add inter-network communication rule: \
iptables failed: iptables --wait -I FORWARD -s 2001:470::1/64 -d 2001:1337::1/64 \
-j DROP: iptables v1.4.21: invalid mask `64' specified
```

column4:
Expected Results:
Docker currently does not deal with IPv6 rules so it could just not do anything in this case either.

column4: Docker hang after intensive run/remove operations
column5: Docker hang after intensive run/remove operations

column4:
Problem description:
Create a container (https://github.com/prasmussen/glot-containers) to compile/execution a source file, read out the output and remove this container. Normally each container will exit in seconds, and we will kill this container if it cannot finish in 30 seconds. We use three threads to repeat the whole process in parallel. Docker hang after thousands of normal operations. One process called 'exe' consumes 100% CPU of one core. I have to reboot the machine to make docker daemon back to work.
```
uname -a
Linux xuyun-workpc 4.2.0-25-generic #30-Ubuntu SMP Mon Jan 18 12:31:50 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

An RMI Against An Image ID That Fails Causes Image To Be Untagged
column5: An RMI Against An Image ID That Fails Causes Image To Be Untagged

column4:
Steps to Reproduce:

1) Run a container with an image using `-d`
2) `docker rmi image_name:tag`

The above will complain that there's an active container running. Run `docker ps` and `docker images` and note how the image you used in Step 1 is still labeled correctly.

3) `docker rmi <id>`, where `<id>` is the id of the image you used in the prior step.

The above will complain that there's an active container running. However, now when you run `docker ps` and `docker images`, the image is now untagged.
Expected Result: A failed `rmi` against an image id should behave the same as an `rmi` against a name+tag in the sense that it should not mutate anything.
column5: Expected Result: A failed `rmi` against an image id should behave the same as an `rmi` against a name+tag in the sense that it should not mutate anything.

Describe the results you received:
My container and my hosts don't see the changes on the volume.
column12: Not sure: Does not match completely the pattern

column4:
Describe the results you expected:
Be able to create file on the host folder and the container can see them.

**List the steps to reproduce the issue:**
 
 1. Mount an NFS location as /var/lib/docker/volumes on 2 docker engines
 2. Create a volume, named `example` when running a container on 1st docker engine
 3. Perform `docker volume ls` on the other docker engine - the volume will not be listed. `volume rm` or `volume inspect` will not work either.
 4. Create a new container on the 2nd docker engine with the `-v example:/path` - this container on the second host is able to read the volume.
 5. Restart 2nd docker engine, `docker volume ls` will list this volume.

**Describe the results you received:**
 
 A docker engine only scans the volumes directory upon startup, as seen [here](https://github.com/docker/docker/blob/master/volume/local/local.go#L79). After that, the data structure used by the local driver knows only about volumes that were created, deleted by the docker engine running on that particular host. If changes happened from another docker-engine to this shared network location, the docker engine doesn't seem to pick it up.

**Describe the results you received:**
 
 A docker engine only scans the volumes directory upon startup, as seen [here](https://github.com/docker/docker/blob/master/volume/local/local.go#L79). After that, the data structure used by the local driver knows only about volumes that were created, deleted by the docker engine running on that particular host. If changes happened from another docker-engine to this shared network location, the docker engine doesn't seem to pick it up.
column5: If changes happened from another docker-engine to this shared network location, the docker engine doesn't seem to pick it up.

column4:
**Describe the results you expected:**
 
 If behaviour were changed to listing all volumes under that folder, and not only the ones created by the docker-engine running on that particular host, multi-host volume management will probably become much easier and not need much more than the local volume plugin.
race condition in volume delete and list
column5: race condition in volume delete and list

column4: Basically, in VolumeStore when there's a Delete operation holding the named lock for a volume and a List operation has just finished listing volumes, but hasn't attempted to add them to the cache yet the list operation will try to acquire the named lock and block. When the Delete operation has finished it will release the named lock and the List operation will be unblocked and it will put the volume in the cache without checking if it still exists after acquiring the lock on the name.
column5: Basically, in VolumeStore when there's a Delete operation holding the named lock for a volume and a List operation has just finished listing volumes, but hasn't attempted to add them to the cache yet the list operation will try to acquire the named lock and block.

When the Delete operation has finished it will release the named lock and the List operation will be unblocked and it will put the volume in the cache without checking if it still exists after acquiring the lock on the name.

column4: docker push should try to push a new tag, and only upload the required layers
column5: docker push should try to push a new tag, and only upload the required layers

column4:
currently the behaviour of "docker push" is to:

* generate a list of layers
* push each layer
* create a manifest file
* push the manifest file

However, the push API, returns an error containing a list of missing layers. Docker push should:
* generate a list of layers: L
* create a manifest file
* push the manifest file
* push the intersection of the error list and L
* if there's an intersection of the error list and L, push the manifest file

column4: DISTINCT does not work with aggregate functions in JPQL
column5: DISTINCT does not work with aggregate functions in JPQL

column4:
The JPQL: SELECT SUM(DISTINCT df.fileSize) from Datafile df is, I believe, valid but is rejected with: org.hibernate.hql.internal.ast.QuerySyntaxException: unexpected token: DISTINCT near line 1, column 14 [SELECT SUM ( DISTINCT df.fileSize ) FROM org.icatproject.core.entity.Datafile df]
 I see that the documentation only states that COUNT(DISTINCT .. will work. However all the aggregate functions should accept the DISTINCT keyword.

column4: problems with discriminator types other than string
column5: problems with discriminator types other than string
The mapping file used was the following:

column4:
When the discriminator is set to type="string" everything works fine, but when it changed, it fails.
The problem is that the code asks base classes for a discriminator value, which is set the fully qualified name of the base class. In this case, it tries to cast the string "ospoint.hibernate.CustLink" to an integer which fails. The exception is:
Caused by: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "ospoint.hibernate.CustLink"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:468)
	at java.lang.Integer.<init>(Integer.java:609)
	at org.hibernate.type.IntegerType.stringToObject(IntegerType.java:53)
	at org.hibernate.persister.SingleTableEntityPersister.<init>(SingleTableEntityPersister.java:253)
	... 27 more

column4:
Hibernate does not seem to differentiate between a procedure call and a function call. I have a function that has one IN param and one OUT param. If I register both it errors out saying incorrect type or number of parameters.
If I don't register the OUT param, it says that this is not a stored procedure.
The API says that ProcedureCall can be used for calling stored procedures and functions.

Then the following HQL query:
select count(a.bs) from A a
produces the following DB2 SQL statement:
select
 count(.) as col_0_0_ 
 from
 A a0_,
 B b1_

which is not legal.
Many-to-one using foreign key from joined table fails
column5: Many-to-one using foreign key from joined table fails

column4: We're implementing the "table per subclass using a discriminator" inheritance strategy with a legacy data model. In one case, a subclass table has a foreign key to another table. The many-to-one relationship mapped to the subclass table works fine, but the inverse one-to-many relationship expects the foreign key to be on the base table rather than the subclass table. As a result, the collection representing the one-to-many relationship generates bad SQL and fails to load.
column5: The many-to-one relationship mapped to the subclass table works fine, but the inverse one-to-many relationship expects the foreign key to be on the base table rather than the subclass table.

column4: We're implementing the "table per subclass using a discriminator" inheritance strategy with a legacy data model. In one case, a subclass table has a foreign key to another table. As a result, the collection representing the one-to-many relationship generates bad SQL and fails to load.

column4: SessionImpl.initializeCollection() does not release JDBC connection (if outside of a transaction)
column5: SessionImpl.initializeCollection() does not release JDBC connection (if outside of a transaction)
column12: The second one takes into account the if statement between parenthesis

column4: With {{ConnectionReleaseMode.AFTER_TRANSACTION}} (the default), Hibernate does not release the JDBC connection when resolving a lazily loaded collection, if this happens *outside* of an active transaction.
column5: With {{ConnectionReleaseMode.AFTER_TRANSACTION}} (the default), Hibernate does not release the JDBC connection when resolving a lazily loaded collection, if this happens *outside* of an active transaction.

column4: When the method {{list}} of a query ({{QueryImpl.java}}) is getting called, Hibernate delegates to {{SessionImpl.list()}}. After having loaded the list, {{SessionImpl.list()}} calls {{SessionImpl.afterOperation()}}, which calls {{jdbcContext.afterNontransactionalQuery()}} (as there is no active transaction). This leads to {{ConnectionManager.afterTransaction()}} which releases the JDBC connection. This is exactly what I expect to happen.
Now to the lazily loaded collection:
column5: Now to the lazily loaded collection:

column4:
{{Hibernate.initialize(collection)}} and {{person.getPets().size()}} both end up in {{SessionImpl.initializeCollection()}}.
This call gets dispatched down to {{Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections()}} and {{Loader.doQuery()}}.
The important fact is, that {{ConnectionManager.afterTransaction()}} never gets called (like in the query-example above).
column5: This call gets dispatched down to {{Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections()}} and {{Loader.doQuery()}}.

column4:
{{Hibernate.initialize(collection)}} and {{person.getPets().size()}} both end up in {{SessionImpl.initializeCollection()}}.
This call gets dispatched down to {{Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections()}} and {{Loader.doQuery()}}.
The important fact is, that {{ConnectionManager.afterTransaction()}} never gets called (like in the query-example above).
column5: The important fact is, that {{ConnectionManager.afterTransaction()}} never gets called (like in the query-example above).

column4: The result is, that the JDBC connection is not released.

IMHO resolving of a lazily loaded collection should behave like executing a query. {{SessionImpl.initializeCollection()}} should call {{SessionImpl.afterOperation()}} in the same way as {{SessionImpl.list()}} is doing this.
column5: IMHO resolving of a lazily loaded collection should behave like executing a query.

column4: IMHO resolving of a lazily loaded collection should behave like executing a query. {{SessionImpl.initializeCollection()}} should call {{SessionImpl.afterOperation()}} in the same way as {{SessionImpl.list()}} is doing this.

column4: Everything works except for the index base, it is always 0 based on insert. I've tried both Hibernate 3.3.2GA and the latest development version (3.5.0-CR-1), the issue can be reproduced in both.
column5: Everything works except for the index base, it is always 0 based on insert.

column4: Everything works except for the index base, it is always 0 based on insert. I've tried both Hibernate 3.3.2GA and the latest development version (3.5.0-CR-1), the issue can be reproduced in both.
column5: I've tried both Hibernate 3.3.2GA and the latest development version (3.5.0-CR-1), the issue can be reproduced in both.

column4: I've joined a test case to reproduce the problem. While working on it, I realized there are updates after the inserts setting the correct index. However, we cannot change the database schema and there's a constraint on the index column enforcing a value > 0. So this issue is really important for us. I could manually handle the index values, but it would be so much easier to let Hibernate do it.
column5: I've joined a test case to reproduce the problem.

column4: Session.flush() does not always cascade save or update to read-only or immutable entities
column5: Session.flush() does not always cascade save or update to read-only or immutable entities

column4: When the session contains only read-only or immutable entities, Session.flush() does not cascade save or update operations to these entities unless the session contains at least one entity that is mutable and not read-only.
column5: When the session contains only read-only or immutable entities, Session.flush() does not cascade save or update operations to these entities unless the session contains at least one entity that is mutable and not read-only.

column4: Flush should cascade the save-update operation as mapped, but save-update operations should not affect read-only or immutable entities themselves.
column5: Flush should cascade the save-update operation as mapped, but save-update operations should not affect read-only or immutable entities themselves.

column4: Polymorphism not always supported for queries and associations when using interface proxies
column5: Polymorphism not always supported for queries and associations when using interface proxies

column4: On our project we have started using Hibernate inheritance widely and we are facing issues when we map entities in the inheritance hierarchies as lazy=true at the class level and when we map polymorphic, single-ended associations (many-to-one and one-to-one).
column5: On our project we have started using Hibernate inheritance widely and we are facing issues when we map entities in the inheritance hierarchies as lazy=true at the class level and when we map polymorphic, single-ended associations (many-to-one and one-to-one).

column4: Originally we were relying on the default Hibernate-generated proxies. We were loading objects polymorphically using iterate or load. In the HQL statement or the parameter to the load method we would specify the superclass type. Also, for polymorphic, single-ended associations we were declaring the property to be of the superclass type. The end result was when we try to downcast an object which should be a subclass into its subclass we get a ClassCastException.

Originally we were relying on the default Hibernate-generated proxies. We were loading objects polymorphically using iterate or load. In the HQL statement or the parameter to the load method we would specify the superclass type. Also, for polymorphic, single-ended associations we were declaring the property to be of the superclass type. The end result was when we try to downcast an object which should be a subclass into its subclass we get a ClassCastException.
column5: Originally we were relying on the default Hibernate-generated proxies.

column4: Originally we were relying on the default Hibernate-generated proxies. We were loading objects polymorphically using iterate or load. In the HQL statement or the parameter to the load method we would specify the superclass type. Also, for polymorphic, single-ended associations we were declaring the property to be of the superclass type. The end result was when we try to downcast an object which should be a subclass into its subclass we get a ClassCastException.
column5: The end result was when we try to downcast an object which should be a subclass into its subclass we get a ClassCastException.

column4: This behavior is well documented in section "19.1.3. Single-ended association proxies" of the Hibernate documentation. In that section it describes a solution using proxy interfaces. So, we created a parallel hierarchy of proxy interfaces for our inheritance hierarchy. There are still issues with this approach. I will summarize the most serious issues we have documented so far:
column5: So, we created a parallel hierarchy of proxy interfaces for our inheritance hierarchy.

column4: This behavior is well documented in section "19.1.3. Single-ended association proxies" of the Hibernate documentation. In that section it describes a solution using proxy interfaces. So, we created a parallel hierarchy of proxy interfaces for our inheritance hierarchy. There are still issues with this approach. I will summarize the most serious issues we have documented so far:
column5: There are still issues with this approach.

column4: 1. If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=true the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load. All possible interfaces are proxied, both correct interfaces and incorrect interfaces. This makes instanceof operations unreliable. The ClassCastException is simply deferred to the time when a method from the wrong subclass interface is invoked.
column5: 1 If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=true the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load.

column4: 1. If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=true the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load. All possible interfaces are proxied, both correct interfaces and incorrect interfaces. This makes instanceof operations unreliable. The ClassCastException is simply deferred to the time when a method from the wrong subclass interface is invoked.
column5: All possible interfaces are proxied, both correct interfaces and incorrect interfaces.

column4: 1. If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=true the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load. All possible interfaces are proxied, both correct interfaces and incorrect interfaces. This makes instanceof operations unreliable. The ClassCastException is simply deferred to the time when a method from the wrong subclass interface is invoked.
column5: This makes instanceof operations unreliable.

column4: 1. If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=true the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load. All possible interfaces are proxied, both correct interfaces and incorrect interfaces. This makes instanceof operations unreliable. The ClassCastException is simply deferred to the time when a method from the wrong subclass interface is invoked.
column5: The ClassCastException is simply deferred to the time when a method from the wrong subclass interface is invoked.

column4: 2. If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=true the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded via single-ended associations (many-to-one or one-to-one). Same behavior as bullet point #1.
column5: 2 If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=true the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded via single-ended associations (many-to-one or one-to-one).

column4: 3. If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=false the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load. The object cannot be downcast to its subclass.
column5: 3 If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=false the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load.

column4: 3. If the superclass is mapped as lazy=true and the subclass is mapped as lazy=false the subclass objects will not exhibit proper behavior when loaded polymorphically with iterate or load. The object cannot be downcast to its subclass.
column5: The object cannot be downcast to its subclass.

column4: Changing all class-level mappings for all classes in the inheritance hierarchy to lazy=false AND changing all single-ended associations to eager fetch seems to resolve the issue. However, we do not desire to eager fetch all these objects.
column5: Changing all class-level mappings for all classes in the inheritance hierarchy to lazy=false AND changing all single-ended associations to eager fetch seems to resolve the issue.

column4: I have uploaded an entire Eclipse project which demonstrates the issues with the proxy interface approach. To run the tests in the project you need to do the following steps:
column5: I have uploaded an entire Eclipse project which demonstrates the issues with the proxy interface approach.

column4:
1. Import the project into Eclipse
2. Setup your DB connection properties in src/main/resources/local.properties
3. Run the script in DB.txt against your target schema

column4: SqlServerDialect should support SQL 2000 which does not support the row_number function
column5: SqlServerDialect should support SQL 2000 which does not support the row_number function

column4: As a fix to HHH-2655 a patch has been applied to SQLServerDialect that make use of the row_number function for paged results. As I can see from the comments of SQLServerDialect, this dialect should be fine for sql server 2000, but sql server 2000 does not support row_number function.
column5: As I can see from the comments of SQLServerDialect, this dialect should be fine for sql server 2000, but sql server 2000 does not support row_number function.

column4: There should be a new dialect that extends the SQLServerDialect one which will add support for paged results throw the row_number function.
column5: There should be a new dialect that extends the SQLServerDialect one which will add support for paged results throw the row_number function.

column4: Cannot load entities with Clob or Lob properties into stateless sessions
column5: Cannot load entities with Clob or Lob properties into stateless sessions

column4: If Lobs in stateless sessions isn't supported, then at very least an error message to that effect should be thrown and the docs should be updated to reflect this, but I don't see why that should be the case, especially considering that both Lobs and stateless session both serve very similar purposes, they are for use when dealing with large datasets that may not fit in memory, and so could well be used together.
column5: If Lobs in stateless sessions isn't supported, then at very least an error message to that effect should be thrown and the docs should be updated to reflect this, but I don't see why that should be the case, especially considering that both Lobs and stateless session both serve very similar purposes, they are for use when dealing with large datasets that may not fit in memory, and so could well be used together.

column4: Digging in heap dumps to solve a memory leak problem I found that some memory was wasted by multiple instances of String holding the exact same sql query in the EntityLoader class (the 'sql' instance variable). column4: When saving a new (transient) entity by cascading from a JPA merge() operation on its parent, Hibernate will generate [at least] two INSERT statements for the new entity when it is held in a UserCollectionType.
column5: When saving a new (transient) entity by cascading from a JPA merge() operation on its parent, Hibernate will generate [at least] two INSERT statements for the new entity when it is held in a UserCollectionType.

column4: When not specifying a UserCollectionType, the problem does not occur.
column5: When not specifying a UserCollectionType, the problem does not occur.

column4: The example/test case attached demonstrates the problem; the HibernateCollectionTest succeeds (and uses a model without the UserCollectionType internally), the UserCollectionTest fails with exactly the same operations, but the UserCollectionType (/jpaSandbox/src/main/java/de/soflimo/sandbox/model/impl/CustomList.java) specified in the mapping.
column5: The example/test case attached demonstrates the problem; the HibernateCollectionTest succeeds (and uses a model without the UserCollectionType internally), the UserCollectionTest fails with exactly the same operations, but the UserCollectionType (/jpaSandbox/src/main/java/de/soflimo/sandbox/model/impl/CustomList.java) specified in the mapping.

column4:
3. save(folder) implemented by FolderService.save() performs a JPA merge() on the detached and modified folder. This, again, is executed within a transaction.
When using the built-in hibernate collection handling, this succeeds; but when specifying the CustomList UserCollectionType in the model mapping, committing this transaction fails because it tries to INSERT [at least] a second row with an identical uniqueKey.
column5: When using the built-in hibernate collection handling, this succeeds; but when specifying the CustomList UserCollectionType in the model mapping, committing this transaction fails because it tries to INSERT [at least] a second row with an identical uniqueKey.

column4: The saveOrUpdate works as expected and the delete of ChildB is audited correctly.

column4: The new natural id code introduced in 4.1.1 depends on the order the entity persisters are loaded which leads to fatal errors
column5: The new natural id code introduced in 4.1.1 depends on the order the entity persisters are loaded which leads to fatal errors

column4: After upgrade to 4.1.1, our application doesn't work anymore because the sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString field of the entity persister is null while it shouldn't be.
column5: After upgrade to 4.1.1, our application doesn't work anymore because the sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString field of the entity persister is null while it shouldn't be.

column4: -> if the root persister is not postInstantiate()d yet (which is our case here), sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString is null and so is the one of the concrete class leading to fatal error when trying to execute queries using the natural id.
column5: -> if the root persister is not postInstantiate()d yet (which is our case here), sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString is null and so is the one of the concrete class leading to fatal error when trying to execute queries using the natural id.

column4: In this case, we should force the postInstantiation of the root entity persister before using sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString (or we should at least generate its sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString).
column5: In this case, we should force the postInstantiation of the root entity persister before using sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString (or we should at least generate its sqlEntityIdByNaturalIdString).

column4:
When I do a HQL query as:

SELECT count(*) FROM table WHERE property = 'value'

and right afterwards I do:

FROM table WHERE property = 'value' ORDER BY other.property

the resulting rows won't be ordered if I activate cashing and use the same query-cash-region. If I include the ORDER BY clause to the first statement, everything is fine.

When I do a HQL query as:

and right afterwards I do:

column4: Objects fetched after query-cache expires are not refreshed in L2 cache
column5: Objects fetched after query-cache expires are not refreshed in L2 cache

column4:
1. Assuming all caches all empty, we run a query. The ids of the returned objects are stored in the query cache and the objects are stored in the L2 object cache. Great so far. 
2. Now, the query cache expires before the object cache does. The query is re-ran and the ids of the returned objects are cached in the query cache.
3. The object cache expires. The query cache is still valid, so the ids are returned from the query cache. Unfortunately, the objects are no longer cached and hibernate fetches them all one-by-one, which takes forever.

column4: Now the question: Why doesn't the query cache update the objects returned in step 2? The objects were fetched form the database, so we have a fresher version of them and an update of the L2 object cache could be performed. This way, the object cache wouldn't expire in step 3.
column5: Now the question: Why doesn't the query cache update the objects returned in step 2?

column4:
This behavior forces the one-by-one fetching of objects: 
* When the query cache expires first, it won't cache the objects (as described), which will eventually lead to a situation where the query cache is valid and the object cache expired.
* When the object cache expires with the query cache still valid, hibernate performs a one-by-one fetching of all objects that are returned by the query cache.
column5: * When the query cache expires first, it won't cache the objects (as described), which will eventually lead to a situation where the query cache is valid and the object cache expired.

column4: @Lob + @Nationalized results in NCLOB on SQLServer2005+ rather than NVARCHAR(MAX)
column5: @Lob + @Nationalized results in NCLOB on SQLServer2005+ rather than NVARCHAR(MAX)

column4: Issue HHH-3965 partly resolved this issue for non-nationalized characters by mapping CLOB to VARCHAR(MAX); however under the {SQLServer2008Dialect} which extends {SQLServer2005Dialect}, using the @Lob and @Nationalized annotations results in mapping to a NCLOB data type which doesn't exist for SQL Server.
column5: Issue HHH-3965 partly resolved this issue for non-nationalized characters by mapping CLOB to VARCHAR(MAX); however under the {SQLServer2008Dialect} which extends {SQLServer2005Dialect}, using the @Lob and @Nationalized annotations results in mapping to a NCLOB data type which doesn't exist for SQL Server.

column4: What happens is when I call entityManager.merge(...) with newly instantiated object [entityState -> TRANSIENT] with itemPredecessor map having some entries in it, hibernate invokes callback method populateSet() with copy of instance passed to merge() which doesn't contain itemPredecessor map with respective entries as itemPredecessor is marked @Transient. column4: As of Infinispan 7, Cache.size() returns the total size of the cluster-wide cache space. This method should use cache.getAdvancedCache().withFlags(Flag.CACHE_MODE_LOCAL, Flag.SKIP_CACHE_LOAD).size() to return just the in-memory entries.
column5: As of Infinispan 7, Cache.size() returns the total size of the cluster-wide cache space.

column4: As of Infinispan 7, Cache.size() returns the total size of the cluster-wide cache space. This method should use cache.getAdvancedCache().withFlags(Flag.CACHE_MODE_LOCAL, Flag.SKIP_CACHE_LOAD).size() to return just the in-memory entries.
column5: This method should use cache.getAdvancedCache().withFlags(Flag.CACHE_MODE_LOCAL, Flag.SKIP_CACHE_LOAD).size() to return just the in-memory entries.

column4: Closing Licence.odt crashes LibreOffice
column5: Closing Licence.odt crashes LibreOffice

column4:
Hello @ll,
someone from the Germanophone community reported the following:
If you have started LO (and only, if you have the StartCenter open), go to "Help – Licence information" (roughly translated from the Germanophone version of LO) and click on the "x" to close the window, LibreOffice crashes immediately without any further warning ... :(
column5: If you have started LO (and only, if you have the StartCenter open), go to "Help – Licence information" (roughly translated from the Germanophone version of LO) and click on the "x" to close the window, LibreOffice crashes immediately without any further warning ... :(

column4:
I tried to use the user defined animation "increas font size" (in German: Schriftgröße ändern) with the default value 150% and I get an undefined picture of the font color. This is a regression to former versions of OOo / LibreOffice. It worked in my former presentations very well.
This error occurs if I don't use hardware acceleration. If I use hardware acceleration every thing works fine.
I tested the same animation (same presentation) with OOo 3.4-m100 (without hardware acceleration) and every thing works as expected.
My system: Dual Core2 (2 Ghz), 4 GB RAM, Nvidia Mobility 9600M GS, openSuSE 11.3-x64, KDE 3.4, LibreOffice 3.3.1-RC2(x64).

column4: Easier toolbar editing / customization (allow drag & drop)
column5: Easier toolbar editing / customization (allow drag & drop)

column4: The current toolbars are very flexible, but they are painful to manage/edit because you cannot use drag and drop to do so. Instead, you need to go into Tools > Customize, mess with categories and open/close dialogs each time you want to add an item, which is quite tedious.
column5: The current toolbars are very flexible, but they are painful to manage/edit because you cannot use drag and drop to do so.

column4: My issue is that after changing settings a bit, LibreOffice would suddenly no longer do any sort of spell-checking. I installed dictionaries, extensions, etc... Nothing would work, not even clearing the user profile or changing Tools-Options-Language Settings defaults would fix  it.

column4: Basically, the result is that no spellchecking at all would work. I use two languages, English-Canada and French-Canada. And both failed to spellcheck. I would click the spell-check button and it would give this:
column5: Basically, the result is that no spellchecking at all would work.

column4: Basically, the result is that no spellchecking at all would work. I use two languages, English-Canada and French-Canada. And both failed to spellcheck. I would click the spell-check button and it would give this:

column4: As you can see, there's no language set and spellcheck did nothing. However, the normal way to fix this would be to use Tools-Language-For All Text-English (Canada). I did it and it didn't change anything. Same issue when I try "For this paragraph". It doesn't remember the setting :

column4: Oddly enough, if I selected the whole text and went to "This selection"- English (Canada), it would suddenly work and underline in red typos:
column5: Oddly enough, if I selected the whole text and went to "This selection"- English (Canada), it would suddenly work and underline in red typos:

column4: So as you can see, the bug is that if you have a default font language set to "None" in my example, using "This Text" should override it or outright change the default to English (Canada).
column5: So as you can see, the bug is that if you have a default font language set to "None" in my example, using "This Text" should override it or outright change the default to English (Canada).

column4: I know it being set to "None" a bit silly but it's also do-able if set to another language. For example, I'm French and I set the default font to French (Canada). Now, "This selection" is checked at French (Canada). When I click "This Text"-English (Canada), it fails to change it to English (Canada) and keeps the spellcheck at French (Canada) unless I change it manually through "This selection" or re-change the default font.
column5: When I click "This Text"-English (Canada), it fails to change it to English (Canada) and keeps the spellcheck at French (Canada) unless I change it manually through "This selection" or re-change the default font.

column4: RTL / LTR and right/left alignment buttons' icons should not be reversed in RTL interface
column5: RTL / LTR and right/left alignment buttons' icons should not be reversed in RTL interface

column4: When using an LTR interface (such as English), the RTL/LTR toolbar buttons have arrows pointing to the left (for LTR) and to the right (for RTL), which is the correct behaviour. However, when switching to an RTL interface (such as Hebrew) the buttons' icons are reversed. This is wrong, please do not swap the buttons' icons in RTL mode. Thanks.
column5: However, when switching to an RTL interface (such as Hebrew) the buttons' icons are reversed.

column4: PIVOTTABLE: floating-point data from database getting converted to date
column5: PIVOTTABLE: floating-point data from database getting converted to date

column4:
Problem description:
When LibreOffice calc retrieves floating-point data from a LibreOffice database (odb file) while having a locale setting with comma as the decimal separator, a floating-point number from the database may get changed by calc (and therefore lost from the spreadsheet) into a date. That is, a number like 2.12 gets changed into an integer (in this example, 40879) which yields 2/12/01 (December 2nd 2011) in date format. The floating-point data is then forever lost.

Problem description:
When LibreOffice calc retrieves floating-point data from a LibreOffice database (odb file) while having a locale setting with comma as the decimal separator, a floating-point number from the database may get changed by calc (and therefore lost from the spreadsheet) into a date. That is, a number like 2.12 gets changed into an integer (in this example, 40879) which yields 2/12/01 (December 2nd 2011) in date format. The floating-point data is then forever lost.

column4:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a txt file like the following (without the pounds of course):
##########################
numbers field
22,1 a
22 b
55,1 c
5,501 d
5,5001 e
5,50001 f
##########################

2. Fire up database and connect to that txt file for it to create a table from that txt file using space as field separator and comma as decimal separator. Save that odb file and register it to your data sources (so you can later access it from calc) 

2.a. check that in the database, everything seems ok; double-clicking the table you just created gives you:
#########################
numbers field
22,10 a
22,00 b
55,10 c
5,50 d
5,50 e
5,50 f
#########################
and right-clicking the table and selecting "edit" shows you that:
#########################
Field Name   Field Type
numbers     Decimal [ DECIMAL ]
field      Text [ VARCHAR ]
#########################

3. fire up calc, go to Data -> DataPilot -> Start... -> Data source registered in LibreOffice
In "Database", select your data source, this one you have just registered
In "Data Source", select the table with that test data you have just created
In "Type", select "sheet"
Confirm. Then, in the box that appears, drag "field" to the "Row fields" area, and then do the same with "numbers".

OBS: this appears to be a problem in the integration between base and calc, since base sees everything as floats and knows where the decimal separator is and calc simply converts data to whatever it thinks it is. Numbers come to calc with dots even though the locale is set to use commas both system-wide and LibreOffice-wide, and numbers within date range (between 1 and 31 for days and 1 and 12 for months) get converted to date. Notice that 55,1 and 5,50001 didn't get converted to date but got converted to text and 5,501 simply lost it's decimal information (maybe got converted to a year??)
This also happens if the txt is created with dots instead of commas and base is told to use dot as decimal separator. Base shows things as they should be, and calc shows them messed up. I think it is absurd to have the date autoformatting in DataPilots since the data is being retrieved from a database (and therefore cannot be a typo); it has been suggested before to have an option to disable the autoconverting of strings with numbers and dots into dates and I see here a good reason why the software should be told when it **doesn't** know better than the user. In DataPilots there shouldn't even exist an option to "autofix" things, since anything wrong there must be fixed in the database, which relies externally, and should those things be fixed automatically in the spreadsheet, mistakes in the database might get unnoticed.
As DataPilot cells are locked against formatting, cell formatting is not an option. Also, trying to change the style of text of the DataPilot entries doesn't work. Changing the locale of the whole LibreOffice suite to one that uses dot as decimal separator solves it, but that is **not** an option either (I have documents that must be published countries where comma is the standard for decimal separator) and this behaviour is not what it is supposed to be anyway; calc should be able to understand what data are strings and what are floats anywhere in the world.
column5: OBS: this appears to be a problem in the integration between base and calc, since base sees everything as floats and knows where the decimal separator is and calc simply converts data to whatever it thinks it is.

column5: In DataPilots there shouldn't even exist an option to "autofix" things, since anything wrong there must be fixed in the database, which relies externally, and should those things be fixed automatically in the spreadsheet, mistakes in the database might get unnoticed.

column4:
OBS: this appears to be a problem in the integration between base and calc, since base sees everything as floats and knows where the decimal separator is and calc simply converts data to whatever it thinks it is. Numbers come to calc with dots even though the locale is set to use commas both system-wide and LibreOffice-wide, and numbers within date range (between 1 and 31 for days and 1 and 12 for months) get converted to date. Notice that 55,1 and 5,50001 didn't get converted to date but got converted to text and 5,501 simply lost it's decimal information (maybe got converted to a year??)
This also happens if the txt is created with dots instead of commas and base is told to use dot as decimal separator. Base shows things as they should be, and calc shows them messed up. I think it is absurd to have the date autoformatting in DataPilots since the data is being retrieved from a database (and therefore cannot be a typo); it has been suggested before to have an option to disable the autoconverting of strings with numbers and dots into dates and I see here a good reason why the software should be told when it **doesn't** know better than the user. In DataPilots there shouldn't even exist an option to "autofix" things, since anything wrong there must be fixed in the database, which relies externally, and should those things be fixed automatically in the spreadsheet, mistakes in the database might get unnoticed.
As DataPilot cells are locked against formatting, cell formatting is not an option. Also, trying to change the style of text of the DataPilot entries doesn't work. Changing the locale of the whole LibreOffice suite to one that uses dot as decimal separator solves it, but that is **not** an option either (I have documents that must be published countries where comma is the standard for decimal separator) and this behaviour is not what it is supposed to be anyway; calc should be able to understand what data are strings and what are floats anywhere in the world.

column4: Writer input fields are not populated using the Java UNO API
column5: Writer input fields are not populated using the Java UNO API

column4: I've been using OpenOffice and LibreOffice to batch process documents using the Java UNO interface.  Upon updating to LibreOffice 3.4.3, LibreOffice is ignoring the Java UNO calls to populate the input fields with data.  Running the same code with LibreOffice 3.3 works flawlessly.  Below is sample code, which I've stepped through in debug mode, and everything is running correctly.  The fields are found, but calling xPropertySet.setPropertyValue("Content", newValue) leaves the document unchanged. Updating table cells with 3.4.3, however, is working as expected.  Has something changed with the API that is not documented?

[1] Open new text document.

column4: compatibility issue with DOC format: Writer creates additional character styles (FILESAVE problem)
column5: compatibility issue with DOC format: Writer creates additional character styles (FILESAVE problem)

column4:
In LibO Writer I've noticed a compatibility issue with DOC format (MS
Word 97/2000/XP/2003): when Writer saves to DOC format it creates
additional character styles.
column5:
In LibO Writer I've noticed a compatibility issue with DOC format (MS
Word 97/2000/XP/2003): when Writer saves to DOC format it creates
additional character styles.

column4:
Steps to reproduce (test files are attached):

(1) test1.doc was created with MS Word 2003 SP3 using the default
normal.dot template. Check the list of all styles (including the
character styles) in the document.

(2) In Writer open test1.doc. In the list of paragraph and character
styles there are some new character styles with odd names:
WW8Num10z0, WW8Num5z0, WW8Num6z0, WW8Num7z0, WW8Num8z0.
Save the document as test2.doc and exit.

(3) In Writer open test2.doc. In the list of paragraph and character
styles there is a new character style: Absatz-Standardschriftart.
Save the document as test3.doc and exit.

(4) In Writer open test3.doc. In the list of paragraph and character
styles there is a new character style: WW-Absatz-Standardschriftart.
Save the document as test4.doc and exit.

(5) In Writer open test4.doc. In the list of paragraph and character
styles there is a new character style: WW-Absatz-Standardschriftart1.
Save the document as test5.doc and exit.

(6) In Writer open test5.doc. In the list of paragraph and character
styles there is a new character style: WW-Absatz-Standardschriftart11.

If a DOC file is opened and saved between Writer and MS Word you get
the same result but with slightly different names of new character
styles (WW-Default Paragraph Font*).
column5:
If a DOC file is opened and saved between Writer and MS Word you get
the same result but with slightly different names of new character
styles (WW-Default Paragraph Font*).

column4:
This behavior is annoying as after many save/open cycles the list of
styles gets cluttered with styles not used in the text actually.
column5:
This behavior is annoying as after many save/open cycles the list of
styles gets cluttered with styles not used in the text actually.

column4: The issue does not exist if the DOCX format is used.
column5: The issue does not exist if the DOCX format is used.

column4: UI - FILESAVE WIN file dialog name field empty on Windows XP with certain settings
column5: UI - FILESAVE WIN file dialog name field empty on Windows XP with certain settings

column4:
Problem description: 
When saving to ODT a modified document from any other format (DOC or RTF being most often with me) the Save As dialog doesn't pre-fill the 'File name' field with the original DOC filename leaving it empty, but only if no other ODT documents being already in the destination folder present. If there is at least one other ODT document, the filename is pre-filled.

Problem description: 
When saving to ODT a modified document from any other format (DOC or RTF being most often with me) the Save As dialog doesn't pre-fill the 'File name' field with the original DOC filename leaving it empty, but only if no other ODT documents being already in the destination folder present. If there is at least one other ODT document, the filename is pre-filled.

If there is at least one other ODT document, the filename is pre-filled.
column5: If there is at least one other ODT document, the filename is pre-filled.

column4: This behaviour is the same with Spreadsheets (tested with XLS to ODS) so I believe all other modules behave the same way.
column5: This behaviour is the same with Spreadsheets (tested with XLS to ODS) so I believe all other modules behave the same way.

column4:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create folder, put 2 RTF documents into it with any content named Test1.rtf and Test2.rtf....
2. Open Test1.rtf, make some changes, save, choose save as ODT
3. Save As dialog's File name filed will be empty.
4. Fill in text Test1 into the File name filed and save the document. Test1.odt will be created.
5. Open the Test2.rtf, make some changes, save, choose as ODT
6. Save As dialog's File name filed will be pre-filled with text Test2 now

Expected behavior:
Save As dialog's File name filed should be pre-filled with the document's name even if the destination folder doesn't contain any other ODT documents

Expected behavior:
Save As dialog's File name filed should be pre-filled with the document's name even if the destination folder doesn't contain any other ODT documents

column4: UI: Command-V doesn't paste in search field
column5: UI: Command-V doesn't paste in search field

column4:
Created attachment 63171
Active search field, value pasted in the wrong place.
column5: Active search field, value pasted in the wrong place.

column4:
Problem description: 
When I paste a value from the clipboard (using keyboard shortcut: command-V) when the search field is active, the value still gets pasted in the spreadsheet instead of in the search field.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Cut/Copy something into your clipboard (for example cut the value from a cell in the spreadsheet by clicking on it and pressing command-X)
2. Select a (different) visible cell in the spreadsheet (by clicking on it)
3. Activate the search field (either by pressing command-F or by clicking edit > find, confirm that the search field is active by typing something and having it appear in the search field)/
4. Paste the content of your clipboard (by pressing command-V)

Current behavior:
The pasted value (step 4) goes into the currently selected cell on the spreadsheet, not in the active search field.
column5:
Current behavior:
The pasted value (step 4) goes into the currently selected cell on the spreadsheet, not in the active search field.

column4:
Expected behavior:
The pasted value (step 4) goes into the active search field, not into the selected cell on the spreadsheet.
column5:
Expected behavior:
The pasted value (step 4) goes into the active search field, not into the selected cell on the spreadsheet.

column4: VIEWING: Calc doesn't show cell color background when dark theme is use in the desktop
column5: VIEWING: Calc doesn't show cell color background when dark theme is use in the desktop

column4:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Install Boje Theme in Ubuntu/Mint: 
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:upubuntu-com/gtk3 
sudo apt-get update 
sudo apt-get install boje-theme
2. Open Calc and change the background color of a cell to yellow (or another color).
3. Save the document.
4. Close Calc.
5. Set the desktop theme to boje-turquoise (for example).
6. Open Calc.
7. Open the saved document.
8. Verify the cell background color.

Current behavior:
The cell color is actually set to the correct color, but it is not shown when a dark theme is used.
column5:
Current behavior:
The cell color is actually set to the correct color, but it is not shown when a dark theme is used.

column4:
Expected behavior:
The cell background should be shown.
column5:
Expected behavior:
The cell background should be shown.

column4: It's well known that 0^0 doesn't exist, but LibO says that 0^0=1
column5: It's well known that 0^0 doesn't exist, but LibO says that 0^0=1

column4: The ODF 1.2 standard says 0^0 shall be 0, 1 or an Error. The choice is implementation-defined.
column5: The ODF 1.2 standard says 0^0 shall be 0, 1 or an Error.

column4: To see the bug in LibO, just put =0^0 in a cell.
column5: To see the bug in LibO, just put =0^0 in a cell.

column4:
---------Steps to reproduce---------
1. Make sure you are logged in to ask.libreoffice.org
 2. Head to http://ask.libreoffice.org/en/feedback/?next=/en/question/7848/is-this-an-asklibo-answer-or-a-junk-mail/
 3. Copy and paste a long passage of text into the message box (>1000 characters should be enough)
 4. Include an apologetic note to the web-administration team and make sure to clarify that you are sending them this message for test purposes only (just in case it does make it through ;))
 5. Hit "Send"
FORMATTING: Crashing after unifying and centering
column5: FORMATTING: Crashing after unifying and centering

column4:
Problem description: 
I've been accidentally unifying all the cells of a certain row and then I wrote something inside the resulting cell. Of course, when trying to center the words inside the resulting cell, LibreOffice crashed. The reason is obvious: impossible to calculate the exact center of an infinite width cell.
column5: Of course, when trying to center the words inside the resulting cell, LibreOffice crashed.

column4:
Steps to reproduce:
1. right click on a row number (left side of the screen)
2. select "unify" cells
3. write something inside the resulting cell and then align center it

Current behavior:
crash
column5:
Current behavior:
crash

column4:
Expected behavior:
not to crash. Maybe just centering the word beyond the limits of the current view or beyond the limits of the last wrote cell on the right side.
column5:
Expected behavior:
not to crash.

column4:
Steps to recreate:
1. download and uncompress http://www.cisco.com/web/about/ac50/ac47/3015_eps.zip
2. Open LibreOffice Draw
3. Select Gallary from Tools Menu
4. Click New Theme... button
5. Click [Find Files...] button and select the directory in which you uncompressed the .eps files
6. Click [Add All] button
7. Select the theme you created to display the clipart you added
8. Drag and drop one or more added clipart items onto the drawing
9. Optional: Add any other objects and text to the drawing

Method 1:
Select Export as PDF from the File menu and perform the export
Open the exported .pdf document with any PDF viewer and observe that the .eps clipart item is not there or not visible.

Method 1:
Select Export as PDF from the File menu and perform the export
Open the exported .pdf document with any PDF viewer and observe that the .eps clipart item is not there or not visible.

Observe that the .eps clipart is not printed or not visible.
column5: Observe that the .eps clipart is not printed or not visible.

column4:

Observe that the EPS clipart is no longer visible in the output.

column4: FORMATTING - Changes inappropriately to different font
column5: FORMATTING - Changes inappropriately to different font

column4:
Bulleted list bug:

0. Open a new document,
1. change the typeface (e.g. to Arial)
2. and type a little bit (e.g. Hello World).

3. Now press the Enter key twice,
4. create a bulleted list.
5. and start typing.
You'll notice the typeface is no longer Arial.
column5: You'll notice the typeface is no longer Arial.

column4:
A similar bug:

0. Open a new document,
1. change the typeface (e.g. to Arial)
2. and type a little bit (e.g. Hello World).

3. Now press Ctrl+A,
4. and then Delete,
5. and then start typing.
Once again, you'll notice the typeface is no longer Arial.
column5: Once again, you'll notice the typeface is no longer Arial.

column4:
Open a new spreadsheet:
Type a lower case i in A1.
A1, correctly now has i with a red wavy underlining indicating a spelling error.
Select A1 and A2, CNTL-1->Font and change to Language[None].
Red wavy underlining indicating a spelling error remains in A1.
However, typing i in A2 gives an i without underlining.
But selecting A1 and A2 again then CNTL-X and CNTL-V gives wavy underlining in both A1 and A2.
(CNTL-1->Font still gives Language[None].)

column5:
Created attachment 113682

column4:
To replicate: 

1. Create multiple variables.
2. Insert multiple input fields for those variables in close proximity to each other (within 1-3 lines or so).
3. Click on one of the fields and type something in.
OR
3. Insert a variable field for one of these variables elsewhere in the document, double-click on that and edit it.

Current behavior:

Characters at the beginning and end of nearby(?) input fields get deleted, "pushed out" of the input field and turned into regular text, or replaced with "!!br0ken!!", or some combination of the foregoing.
Sometimes this starts happening even while inserting the input fields.
column5: Sometimes this starts happening even while inserting the input fields.

column4:
Expected behavior:
Editing one variable should never affect any other variable.
Inserting input fields outside of an input field should not affect either old or new input field's variable.

Expected behavior:
Editing one variable should never affect any other variable.
Inserting input fields outside of an input field should not affect either old or new input field's variable.

column4: FILESAVE: Modifying and saving existing CSV does not warn about only saving active sheet
column5: FILESAVE: Modifying and saving existing CSV does not warn about only saving active sheet

column4:
Description:
If you open an existing csv file, create a new sheet, and then do a simple save, you will be encouraged to save as a ods, but will not receive the warning about it only saving the active sheet.  You should always be warned on file-save when you are only saving the active sheet.  The appropriate warning is seen if you use a "Save as..." instead.

Description:
If you open an existing csv file, create a new sheet, and then do a simple save, you will be encouraged to save as a ods, but will not receive the warning about it only saving the active sheet.  You should always be warned on file-save when you are only saving the active sheet.  The appropriate warning is seen if you use a "Save as..." instead.
column5: If you open an existing csv file, create a new sheet, and then do a simple save, you will be encouraged to save as a ods, but will not receive the warning about it only saving the active sheet.

column4:
Description:
If you open an existing csv file, create a new sheet, and then do a simple save, you will be encouraged to save as a ods, but will not receive the warning about it only saving the active sheet.  You should always be warned on file-save when you are only saving the active sheet.  The appropriate warning is seen if you use a "Save as..." instead.
column5: You should always be warned on file-save when you are only saving the active sheet.

column4:
Description:
If you open an existing csv file, create a new sheet, and then do a simple save, you will be encouraged to save as a ods, but will not receive the warning about it only saving the active sheet.  You should always be warned on file-save when you are only saving the active sheet.  The appropriate warning is seen if you use a "Save as..." instead.
column5: The appropriate warning is seen if you use a "Save as..." instead.

column4:
Steps to reproduce:
* Open an existing csv
* Create a new sheet
* Key some data on the new sheet
* Ctrl-s (prompts to save as ods or keep it as csv)
* Choose "Use Text CSV Format" and click OK

Expected:
When saving a csv, you should always get a prompt saying that you are only saving the active sheet.
column5:
Expected:
When saving a csv, you should always get a prompt saying that you are only saving the active sheet.

column4:
Actual:
LibreOffice simply saves the active sheet, discarding the rest of the spreadsheet with no complaints.  Also, any further attempts to save no longer give any prompts to save as ods or warnings that you are only saving the current sheet.

Actual:
LibreOffice simply saves the active sheet, discarding the rest of the spreadsheet with no complaints.  Also, any further attempts to save no longer give any prompts to save as ods or warnings that you are only saving the current sheet.
column5: Also, any further attempts to save no longer give any prompts to save as ods or warnings that you are only saving the current sheet.

column4:
Notes:
If you repeat the steps above and use "Save as..." instead of a normal save, the appropriate prompt IS displayed:

"Warning saving the document test:
Only the active sheet was saved."
column5:
Notes:
If you repeat the steps above and use "Save as..." instead of a normal save, the appropriate prompt IS displayed:

column4: Again, this prompt should ALWAYS be displayed when saving a multi-sheet spreadsheet as a csv.
column5: Again, this prompt should ALWAYS be displayed when saving a multi-sheet spreadsheet as a csv.

column4: I guess one could argue that the user was forced to choose csv over ods at least once, but I know people who have lost work because of this bug.  As I mentioned above, after that initial decision, any subsequent saves go through without any warnings.
column5: As I mentioned above, after that initial decision, any subsequent saves go through without any warnings.

column4:
- Enable the "Overline" button in the "Formatting" toolbar (if not already)
=> It will be displayed next to the Underline button
- Open the attached ods-file
- Press F2 on cell A1 to enter the edit mode
- Use arrow-left and arrow-right keys to move the caret while watching the Overline and Underline button of the Formatting bar

Result: The Underline button changes - as expected - to pressed state while the caret is within the underlined part. But the Overline button does not change to pressed state while the caret is within overlined part of the text.

column4: Mendeley 1.16.1 does not work on LibreOffice 5.1.3.2
column5: Mendeley 1.16.1 does not work on LibreOffice 5.1.3.2

column4:
Hi there.
Reference manager Mendeley was working fine in LO 5.1.2, but after updating to 5.1.3.2 there seems to work only partially:
The plugin is working, I see the tool bar and the "Insert citation" option is available, but after selecting the reference the legend "Formatting citation" appears and does not goes further. It is supposed to load the reference in an specified format from my library.
Uninstalling and reinstalling the plugin did not solve it, neither was resetting the user folder in LibreOffice.
Any help is welcome.
Thanks.

column4: isOpenmrsObjectCollection returns true for collections of non-OpenmrsObject
column5: isOpenmrsObjectCollection returns true for collections of non-OpenmrsObject

column4: isOpenmrsObjectCollection is returning true for collections of objects that are not of type OpenmrsObject.
column5: isOpenmrsObjectCollection is returning true for collections of objects that are not of type OpenmrsObject.

column4: isOpenmrsObjectCollection is returning true for collections of objects that are not of type OpenmrsObject. This is causing attempts to load Save Handlers on commits to the DB (where the method name starts with 'save') on non OpenmrsObjects: this results in casting exceptions that will hault the thread in the AOP (RequiredDataAdvice) before the commit is ever executed.
column5: This is causing attempts to load Save Handlers on commits to the DB (where the method name starts with 'save') on non OpenmrsObjects: this results in casting exceptions that will hault the thread in the AOP (RequiredDataAdvice) before the commit is ever executed.

column5: There is a test for this already:

column4: but there seems to be a problem with it. In my case I discovered the problem by passing a List<RemoteDataTransferQueueItem> object to the isOpenmrsObjectCollection method, which returned true (incorrectly). This error can be recreated by simply passing a List<String> object to the method for simplicity: again it will return true incorrectly. </description>

column4: Relationships lost when creating a new patient and results not refreshed
column5: Relationships lost when creating a new patient and results not refreshed

column4: When a relationship is added when creating a new patient or with the Edit this Patient (Short Form), there is no confirmation that the relationship name has been accepted. If a patient has typed something in that box, it shouldn't allow the form to be submitted until the matching patient names has been clicked in the box. In some systems this may be obvious, but with the number of patients that we have, users will click through thinking it's a text field, and never know that the relationship wasn't recorded.
column5: When a relationship is added when creating a new patient or with the Edit this Patient (Short Form), there is no confirmation that the relationship name has been accepted.

column4: openmrs-lib-cache temp directories not being deleted
column5: openmrs-lib-cache temp directories not being deleted

column4: I have discovered a problem on demo.openmrs.org that may need to be investigated:
column5: I have discovered a problem on demo.openmrs.org that may need to be investigated:

column4: The temp files created named such as <TOMCAT_ROOT>/temp/1275717893280.openmrs-lib-cache/* are not being automatically deleted. Individually, these are rather small, but on the demo site I found a total of 4 GB of these files from the last several months.
column5: The temp files created named such as <TOMCAT_ROOT>/temp/1275717893280.openmrs-lib-cache/* are not being automatically deleted.

column4: The temp files created named such as <TOMCAT_ROOT>/temp/1275717893280.openmrs-lib-cache/* are not being automatically deleted. Individually, these are rather small, but on the demo site I found a total of 4 GB of these files from the last several months.
column5: Individually, these are rather small, but on the demo site I found a total of 4 GB of these files from the last several months.

column4: We don't necessarily do anything unusual on the demo server, but we do undeploy and redeploy the application every night. After that we restart Tomcat by sending a kill signal and restarting it.

column4: Data Entry Statistics Module - Includes voided encountres and obs
column5: Data Entry Statistics Module - Includes voided encountres and obs

column4: The Data Entry Statistics module (version 1.3) includes voided encounters and observations in the table of data entry statistics.
column5: The Data Entry Statistics module (version 1.3) includes voided encounters and observations in the table of data entry statistics.

column4:
How to reproduce...
1.) Run the data entry stats for a period.
2.) Void an encounter.
3.) Run the data entry stats again for the same period.
The results of the data entry statistics will be the same.
column5: The results of the data entry statistics will be the same.

column4: If voiding something in OpenMRS is to be treated the same as deleting it, than this is a bug.
column5: If voiding something in OpenMRS is to be treated the same as deleting it, than this is a bug.

column4: Preferred Patient Identifier should be required
column5: Preferred Patient Identifier should be required

column4: When creating a patient record in OpenMRS, it doesn't require to indicate which identifier is preferred. We should make it required - to have the user to indicate which identifier is preferred. For AMPATH, when using REST module to query patient identifier for LIMS, it picks Kenyan National ID instead of AMPATH ID or AMRS Universal ID when no preferred identifier is indicated. It has created problems for sending the correct HL7 message to AMRS.
column5: When creating a patient record in OpenMRS, it doesn't require to indicate which identifier is preferred.

column4: Improper table constraint of form.encounter_type to users.user_id
column5: Improper table constraint of form.encounter_type to users.user_id

column4: I cannot find where this constraint is created, but it is present in all of my 1.8.2 instances. I have looked in several liquibase changesets and sqldiffs. column4: Duplicate message code within message.properties file
column5: Duplicate message code within message.properties file
There are three codes within the message properties file that have been mistakenly duplicated.
IN each case, one of the duplicates must be removed.

column4: Ideally, any code using these duplicates would be checked and fixed if necessary (e.g., adding a non-duplicating message code if appropriate); however, I don't think this should keep us from correcting these duplicates, especially because we cannot use [Amanuens|http://amanuens.com] for translating our message bundles in trunk until these duplicates are removed.

* Change the serialization-xstream module from the bundled 0.2.5 version to a 0.2.7-SNAPSHOT version

This is a bug.

column4: The new order number test method fails randomly
column5: The new order number test method fails randomly

column4: The OrderServiceTest#getNewOrderNumber_shouldAlwaysReturnUniqueOrderNumbersWhenCalledMultipleTimesWithoutSavingOrders() test method starts multiple threads but is not thread safe. This causes the test to fail randomly. We should modify the test to be thread safe. Thus when it fails, we will be confident that it signifies a defect in the code being tested.
column5: The OrderServiceTest#getNewOrderNumber_shouldAlwaysReturnUniqueOrderNumbersWhenCalledMultipleTimesWithoutSavingOrders() test method starts multiple threads but is not thread safe.

This causes the test to fail randomly. We should modify the test to be thread safe. Thus when it fails, we will be confident that it signifies a defect in the code being tested.
column5: This causes the test to fail randomly.

column4: The OrderServiceTest#getNewOrderNumber_shouldAlwaysReturnUniqueOrderNumbersWhenCalledMultipleTimesWithoutSavingOrders() test method starts multiple threads but is not thread safe. This causes the test to fail randomly. We should modify the test to be thread safe. Thus when it fails, we will be confident that it signifies a defect in the code being tested.
column5: We should modify the test to be thread safe.

column4: The thread safety issue is caused by having multiple threads that share a state in a non-thread safe {{HashSet}}. This can be corrected by wrapping the set in a thread safe proxy using the {{Collections#synchronizedSet(Set)}} method.
column5: The thread safety issue is caused by having multiple threads that share a state in a non-thread safe {{HashSet}}.

column4: value_coded column should be included in merge concepts module
column5: value_coded column should be included in merge concepts module

column4: I tested out Jordan's most recent version of the merge concepts module (see here:https://tickets.openmrs.org/browse/TRUNK-2351), and noticed that it does not work correctly when it comes to answer concepts, which are stored in the value_coded column.;
column5: I tested out Jordan's most recent version of the merge concepts module (see here:https://tickets.openmrs.org/browse/TRUNK-2351), and noticed that it does not work correctly when it comes to answer concepts, which are stored in the value_coded column.

column4: When i tested it, the module cited that the obs count for these two concepts was 0, even though I knew through my own query that there were several instances of the two concepts in the value_coded column of the obs table. It appears that the module is checking against the concept_id column of the obs table, which works if the concept is a question. However, because the concept may be an answer to a question, it also needs to check against the value_coded column of the obs table. When the merge was completed, I saw that the entries in the value_coded column remained as they were originally.

column4: Incorrect behavior of Person.getPersonName() and getPersonAddress() for a voided Person

column4: If a person is voided, then all of their names, addresses, etc are voided. Thus calling getPersonName() or getPersonAddress() on a voided person returns null.

column4: Exiting a patient from care causes "not-null property references a null or transient value: org.openmrs.PatientState.dateCreated"
column5: Exiting a patient from care causes "not-null property references a null or transient value: org.openmrs.PatientState.dateCreated"

column4: This occurs when there's an actual state transition during the Exit Patient From Care use case. The scenario is that the user selects an Exit Type that has a final state "trigger" associated with it. When this occurs it causes the Exit From Care to actually perform a state transition, which simply pulls the "transition" state from the database and persist a new PatientState associated with this state. The code then adds this new PatientState to the PatientProgram and saves the patient program, letting Hibernate cascade the save or update operation down through the dependent objects (TRAC-1063). Since the cascade operation does not use (nor should it) the ProgramWorkflowService.savePatientProgram() method, we miss out on the null-checks for the metadata fields, which means Hiberante tries to persist the PatientState object with null values for some required fields.

This occurs when there's an actual state transition during the Exit Patient From Care use case. The scenario is that the user selects an Exit Type that has a final state "trigger" associated with it. Since the cascade operation does not use (nor should it) the ProgramWorkflowService.savePatientProgram() method, we miss out on the null-checks for the metadata fields, which means Hiberante tries to persist the PatientState object with null values for some required fields.

column4:
Prior to rev:7380, the exception message and stack trace was returned to the client whenever an exception occurred within a Groovy script. This behavior should be restored. Currently, the following script just never returns instead of returning the exception message and stack trace:
{code}foo = null
print foo.bar()
{code}
The above code should return a null pointer exception and stack trace as it did before.

column4: Found Similar People yields excessive results when adding a new person
column5: Found Similar People yields excessive results when adding a new person

column4: When adding a new person, the search for similar people includes too many results. The results for potentially duplicate patients should be refined. For example, when adding a new patient, Fred Flintstone, it comes up with 229 results in our system, including many names which are not even remotely similar. This also causes a significant delay while the list of potentially pre-existing persons is created. When searching for existing patient, Fred Flintstone (like we were going to view them in the dashboard), it yields no persons. This occurs in OpenMRS Version: 1.4.0.23 RC Build 7055. See a sample of the results below...

column4: Person.getAge doesn't always return the correct age sometimes

column4: Person.ageAge currently figures the age down to the hours, minutes, and seconds which returns the wrong age when the birthday time is after the onDate time. Attached are two patches: one fixed the getAge method and one added test cases for the fix.

column4: Ensure a persisted de-identified ID for patient lookup
column5: Ensure a persisted de-identified ID for patient lookup

column4: One of our epidemiologists just pointed out that Medical Record Numbers are actually considered identifying information, and that an IRB would not be cool with using them for any sort of results reporting or formal research. A quick google search shows that HIPAA explicitly mentions MRNs as identifying info.
column5: One of our epidemiologists just pointed out that Medical Record Numbers are actually considered identifying information, and that an IRB would not be cool with using them for any sort of results reporting or formal research.

column4: The issue here is that if you want to do anything even vaguely research-related with a system, every patient should have a non-MRN ID that can be used to re-identify them later. Our epidemiologist had been using patientId for this purpose, but this number is not persisted when a patient is merged into another. This seems like something we need to fix.
column5: The issue here is that if you want to do anything even vaguely research-related with a system, every patient should have a non-MRN ID that can be used to re-identify them later.

column4: The issue here is that if you want to do anything even vaguely research-related with a system, every patient should have a non-MRN ID that can be used to re-identify them later. Our epidemiologist had been using patientId for this purpose, but this number is not persisted when a patient is merged into another. This seems like something we need to fix.
column5: Our epidemiologist had been using patientId for this purpose, but this number is not persisted when a patient is merged into another.

column4: ViewPostFragment does not resolve relative urls (patch added)
column5: ViewPostFragment does not resolve relative urls (patch added)

column4:
In my blog, I use relative URLs. This is the case for image URLs and for anchors leading into my blog. I use it anywhere, where I can, so my blog will work after a global domain change, too.

But the Client is not able to resolve them. Images are missing and links are opened with ?file://.. instead of ?http://blog/ ..

I'll add an image of my post view before my patch, a screenshot after my patch and the patch itself, that resolves the problem.
column5: But the Client is not able to resolve them.
